title: SIMD register name for ARM64 is not correct
body:
1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
`go version devel +2f2f22a Tue Apr 26 11:43:44 2016 +0800 linux/arm64`

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?

 ```
GOARCH="arm64"
GOBIN=""
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="arm64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GOPATH="/home/zhoyao01/go:/home/zhoyao01/project/go"
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/home/zhoyao01/project/go"
GOTOOLDIR="/home/zhoyao01/project/go/pkg/tool/linux_arm64"
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -pthread -fmessage-length=0 -fdebug-prefix-map=/tmp/go-build849999969=/tmp/go-build -gno-record-gcc-switches"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"
```
3. What did you do?
    create following arm64 assembly function in file `testvreg.s`:
    ``` asm
    1 TEXT Â·foo(SB),NOSPLIT,$0
    2    AESD V33, V32
    3    AESD V0, V1
    4    RET
   ```
   compile with:
   ```
$ go tool asm testvreg.s
```

4. What did you expect to see?
  ```asm: illegal combination 00020 (testvreg.s:3)   AESD    0, 0 ZOREG NONE ZOREG, 7 7```

5. What did you see instead?
  there should be no `illegal combination` error for `testvreg.s:3`. Because the V-register range is from V0~V31. So the `testvreg.s:2` is `illegal combination`.
